passages.text: Asset-Light Biz Drives \(20\%\) Growth; 70% Payout Rmb1.3bn Net Cash

20% profit growth achievable; deep valuation disc vs asset- light peers; 7% yield - Midea RE focuses on 4 asset- light businesses: project mgmt., prop mgmt., retail & industrial park rentals, and RE technology (incl. prefabrication). With net cash of Rmb1.27bn, mgmt. eyes 20% revenue, 20% profit growth, and 70% payout in '25/26E. We see '25E profit growth as achievable given full- year contribution from project mgmt. (only 2- month in FY24). Its rental profit in 1H25 was 20%yoy growth with narrowing loss in RE technology (likely at profit for FY25). Current valuation (9.8/8.1x PER on '25/26E EPS; 7% yield) is well- below prop mgmt. sector trading at avg 11.0x. Maintain Buy; New TP HK\\$5.9/sh on 10x targeted '26E PE.

Asset- light biz on track - Midea RE operated: 1) construction project mgmt. (1H25: 41% of profit; 25% of revenue): pricing at Rmb100- 120/sqm plus 1- 3% of sales with cap on connected revenue at Rmb1.49/1.33bn in 2025- 26, with a first full- year contribution in '25E; It is backed by GFA under construction of the group & also 4 third parties (mainly SOE) contracts in Guiyang, Wuxi, and Xuzhou with Rmb0.16bn contracted value. We estimate c. Rmb1bn revenue in '25E; 2) property mgmt (1H: 37% of profit: 96.1/79.5m GFA contracted/managed (+4%/14%yoy; 3rd- parties: 20%), with est. 13% of revenue from non- residential (Rmb246m contract value from industrial park; school & hospital); 3) investment properties rentals (1H: 26% of profit), backed by 13 projects managed and 4 industrial parks): 64% NOI margin ('24: 53%); 4) construction & tech biz (incl. prefabrication; 1H25 at breakeven), with Rmb0.29bn new contracts (all from third- parties) in 1H25. For '25E/26E, we expect property & project mgmt. could contribute c.70% of revenue.

Strong B/S: Rmb1.27bn net cash - Midea RE repaid all debt in 1H25, with cash of Rmb0.7bn by Jun- 25. Adding the quasi- cash (incl. wealth mgmt. products) of Rmb0.56bn), Midea RE maintained net cash of Rmb1.27bn.

1H25 beat: First time interim div; 119% profit growth - Core profit for retained business +119%yoy to Rmb312m, beat on new project mgmt. services. At operating profit level: i) prop mgmt. - 13%yoy 5% growth on GFA managed but offset by lower 15.7% GPM (1H24: 19.7%); ii) rentals +20% yoy with 4 industrial parks (1H24: 3); iii) tech at narrowing loss (Rmb8m; 1H24: Rmb47m) iv) project mgmt. is new (from Nov- 24; only 2- month in FY24) at Rmb162m profits. Overall margins at 30.8%/15.6% GPM/ NPM (1H24: 30.8%/10.1%) with net interest income. B/S is strong - Rmb1.27bn net cash ('24: Rmb0.47bn) with no debts. BVPS was Rmb3.47 by Jun- 25.
Source: Powered by dataCentral
Catalyst Watch: Upside, expires 13- SEP- 25
Target price HK\$5.90↑
Expected share price return 23.7%
Expected dividend yield 7.1%
Expected total return 30.8%
Market Cap HK\$6,847M

Direction: Upside Duration: Within 30 Days (expires 13 Sep 2025) Date Added: 13 Aug 2025 Catalyst: Earnings

We open a 30- day Catalyst Watch on Midea RE, as we - (1) Expect it to announce a semi- annual dividend with result in Aug- 2025, funded by its net cash of Rmb0.47bn (2) Estimate a \(9\%\) yield on a \(70\%\) full- year payout ratio (3) Expect \(20\%\) profit growth to be achievable in FY25E, given full- year contribution from project mgmt (only 2 months in FY24 after the privatization of DP in Sep- 24) and a stable property management business
Spread 52pp Current Price and expected returns (upside/downside) as of 29 Aug 2025
GPM 0.5% higher than our base case  - Target 11x 2026E PE
c.10% growth in GFA managed  33- 35% GPM  - Target 10x 2026E PE
GPM 2% lower than our base case  - Target 9x 2026E PE

Established in 2004 and listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2018, Midea Real Estate is a privately- owned property developer in China that is mainly engaged in property development, property management and investment with its core values and competences inherited from Midea Group. By June 2019, Midea RE had 52.5msm GFA landbank in 54 cities, with a focus on its "deep penetration" strategy for five targeted regions: the Pearl River Delta Economic Region, Yangtze River Delta Economic Region, Midstream of Yangtze River Economic Region, North China Region, and Southwest China Economic Region.

Our target price for Midea RE of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 5.9\) is set at 10x PER on EPS for its assetlight biz. Catalyzed by consolidation, more listed property names have transformed their business models into homebuilders with a development focus, faster turnover, lighter assets, stable ROE, and high payouts. With more visibility on growth and earnings against the market cycle, we see a P/E- based valuation approach as appropriate for such property names.

Midea RE is exposed to the property market in China. Weaker- than- expected economic growth globally and/or in China could hurt buying sentiment in China's property market, which could render our sales and earnings estimates for Midea RE inaccurate. On the policy/regulatory front, any tightening by the central government with regard to mortgage applications and approvals, project financing, and property pre- sales could affect the bottom line and cash flow of property developers, as well as homebuyer sentiment.

Company- specific risks include: (i) risks in land acquisition; (ii) potential margin slippage due to soft selling prices or rising costs; (iii) delays in completion or delivery; (iv) potential equity- raising activities; and (v) capital shortfalls due to intensive property development, etc.
Any of these risks could impede the shares from reaching our target price.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
